text: My name is Emmanuel Frenehard.
I'm Chief Digital Officer at Sanofi,

a global biopharmaceutical
company. Within Sanofi, in digital,

our mission is to
shorten the time it takes
to get a new drug to a patient.

When we started our
journey with generative AI
we chose AWS as our partner

because Bedrock was instrumental
in building what we wanted

to do. We used it to create
Concierge. Concierge is kind
of a sidekick for our employees.

We've got about 20K
users of Concierge today,
and it allows our employees

to ask questions about
company practices, policies,
operating procedures, and get a true
curated answer for them.
When we wanted to innovate at scale,

we created a digital
accelerator, which was a team

that was focused on building
new solutions to be able
to shorten a distance between the
patient and their treatment.

And we used the technology
from AWS

to build that,
we built a number of documents
through generative AI in our R&D area.

We use Amazon Web Services to
fine tune third party models

to be able to get to drug
discovery much faster.

And we truly cut across
the company with
what we do with AWS.
We need compute, we need storage,
we need power, we need GPUs.

AWS is really the right partner
for us in what we do here,

because they share the
mission that it's important

to shave time, every step of
the process from the discovery

of a new drug to getting
it to the patient.
